instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_TBT_X</SIGNAL> is shorted and it looks like <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is the issue. It's heating up when I run voltage through the line. Is my only path here to replace <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>? Is there any way around <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>? Would I have power but no ability to do anything else with the USB-C ports if I cut off power to <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>? Or would the computer just not work?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
threads.message: I'm not sure if these will work without <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>. I expect is will but have not confirmed it. If it is shorted it needs to come off anyway so go and find out.
